messages.subject: Re: Need Info :)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ann Zeise (http://www.gomilpitas.com/homeschooling/) Home Education Magazine (http://www.home-ed-magazine.com) Jon s Homeschool Resource Pages
messages.messageBody:
> And I am running into no luck with finding information on the
> homeschooling atmosphere in Norway. I do know it is legal. But can't
> seem to find any current information.

Ann Zeise (http://www.gomilpitas.com/homeschooling/)
Home Education Magazine (http://www.home-ed-magazine.com)
Jon's Homeschool Resource Pages
(http://www.midnightbeach.com/hs/listlist.f.html)

have good links to international groups. But the only page I've seen
referenced about Norway is in Norwegian.

Opplysnings Tjenesten for Hjemmeundervisning
http://bdd.no/oth/

If you don't read Norwegian, there's a website translator at:

http://www.tranexp.com:2000/InterTran?

Give it the URL of the page, pick your from and to languages at the bottom
and hit translate. (Which I think is way cool :-)

It takes a while for the page to load and a while for the translation to
appear so you might need a bit of patience. The output is interesting if not
exactly fine English. ;-)

There's an English abstract that might help:

http://www.bdd.no/oth/english.html

Joyce

messages.subject: Need Info :)
messages.msgSnippet: Hello all, I am trying to find out about homeschooling, unschooling.. In different countries. Next year I will be getting married :). So I will be moving to
messages.messageBody:
Hello all,

I am trying to find out about homeschooling, unschooling.. In
different countries. Next year I will be getting married :).
So I will be moving to Norway. I have been unschooling my son for 2
years. And I am running into no luck with finding information on the
homeschooling atmosphere in Norway. I do know it is legal. But can't
seem to find any current information.
If anyone can help, or knows of someone homeschooling there. I would
much appreciate the help.

Thanks to all, :)

C.Ann
